result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs are to be paid by 5-2-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis.Stats to apply for school and work, if employed. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the relates surcharge.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 7 days time served.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnell Lamont Belcher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The defendant's motion or request for release privileges is Denied by the Court. Copies forwarded to all parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for elder care received in cases 13CF002137 and 14CF000661.  Filed in 13CF002137.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/06/14. AR

Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in court with attorney Mark E Kershek.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SAB
 AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:
  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 7 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for school and work, if employed.
-Court costs are to be paid by 5/2/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the relates surcharge by 5/2/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a $300.00 fine including costs by 5/2/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-6 month drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 5/2/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Paul Hauer for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ted Puente-MPD Officer.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF2137 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Karyn Behling for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Stipulation to an adjournment is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM010615  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/24/14 vf

Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Ronnell Lamont Belcher in custody.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
